page.title: 06THORNDON HALL
page.content: The present Hall is the remains of the 'New Hall' designed by James Paine, started in 1764 and occupied six years later. Part of the 'New Hall' was destroyed by fire in 1878 and the Petre family moved to Ingatestone Hall. At the moment the central part of the hall has been converted into thirty-seven appartments which people lease from Bates the Builders. They are working on the East wing to make sixteen dwellings. The old bakery and stable block have been made into eight cottages. The remaninder of the Hall is used as the offices and Club House of Thorndon Park Golf Club.
